 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָרַח‎</span> **verb** ==be wide, spacious== (Late Hebrew ***id., extend*** (intransitive), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רֶוַח‎</span> ***wide space***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be wide*** (between thighs), and derivatives; compare perhaps Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***make open, open*** (derived species; [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>293</sup>); Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎רְוַח‎</span> ***be wide*** (usually figurative as Hebrew), <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be wide, enlarged***); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ר‎</span>, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ל‎</span> person [[1Sam.16.23|1Sam 16:23]] figurative there ***was enlargement, relief***, for Saul; ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִרְוַח לִי‎</span> [[Job.32.20|Job 32:20]] that ***there may be relief*** for me. **Pu\`al** ***Participle*** plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְרֻוָּחִים‎</span> [[Jer.22.14|Jer 22:14]] ***spacious*** (of rooms; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בֵּות מִדּוֺת‎</span>).
